meanings.definition: To replace or repair the plumbing in a building.
meanings.sent1: The plumber will be replumbing the old pipes in the house next week.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to replumb the bathroom to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: After the mishap, they had to replumb the entire kitchen, what a mess!
meanings.sent4: She felt like replumbing her life, starting fresh with new connections.
meanings.sent5: The sound of replumbing echoed through the walls, signaling progress.

meanings.definition: The act of redoing the plumbing in a structure.
meanings.sent1: The replumbing of the office building took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: A professional was hired to oversee the replumbing of the old house.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about the chaos of replumbing a historic building.
meanings.sent4: The replumbing of the school's water system was a massive undertaking.
meanings.sent5: The elegant design of the replumbing project impressed everyone who saw it.
